intro: Cymbocarpa refracta f. albida, commonly known as the white-fruited cymbocarpa, is a rare and unique plant species belonging to the Rhamnaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive white or pale yellow fruits, which contrast with the typical red or orange hues of the species. The plant is native to specific regions of South America, particularly in areas with high humidity and well-drained soils. Its foliage consists of small, ovate leaves with a smooth texture, and it produces small, inconspicuous flowers during the spring season. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
